  • Constructor Details

    • Wall

      public Wall(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio, Point ballPos)
      Class constructor. Make levels. Set the speed of the ball to random number. Initialize a Player object.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The area that all the components can be drawn.
      brickCount - The number of bricks.
      lineCount - The number of lines the bricks align.
      brickDimensionRatio - The brick dimension ratio.
      ballPos - The ball position.

  • Method Details

    • makeSingleTypeLevel

      private Brick[] makeSingleTypeLevel(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCnt, int lineCnt, double brickSizeRatio, int type)
      Make level with only one type of brick. Make all the bricks based on the type of the brick. Align all the bricks.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The area that all the components can be drawn.
      brickCnt - The number of bricks.
      lineCnt - The number of lines the bricks align.
      brickSizeRatio - The brick size ratio.
      type - The type of brick.
      Returns:
      A Brick array.

    • makeChessboardLevel

      private Brick[] makeChessboardLevel(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCnt, int lineCnt, double brickSizeRatio, int typeA, int typeB)
      Make level in chessboard style with two types of brick. Make all the bricks based on the type of the brick. Align all the bricks.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The area that all the components can be drawn.
      brickCnt - The number of bricks.
      lineCnt - The number of lines the bricks align.
      brickSizeRatio - The brick size ratio.
      typeA - The type of the first brick.
      typeB - The type of the second brick.
      Returns:
      A Brick array.

    • makeChessboardLevel

      private Brick[] makeChessboardLevel(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCnt, int lineCnt, double brickSizeRatio, int typeA, int typeB, int typeC)
      Make level in chessboard style with three types of brick. Make all the bricks based on the type of the brick. Align all the bricks.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The area that all the components can be drawn.
      brickCnt - The number of bricks.
      lineCnt - The number of lines the bricks align.
      brickSizeRatio - The brick size ratio.
      typeA - The type of the first brick.
      typeB - The type of the second brick.
      typeC - The type of the third brick.
      Returns:
      A Brick array.

    • makeLevels

      private Brick[][] makeLevels(Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio)
      Make all the levels using different types of brick.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The area that all the components can be drawn.
      brickCount - The number of bricks.
      lineCount - The number of lines the bricks align.
      brickDimensionRatio - The brick dimension ratio.
      Returns:
      A two-dimensional Brick array.

    • move

      public void move()
      Move the player and the ball.

    • findImpacts

      public void findImpacts()
      Do the corresponding actions when the ball is in impact with all the components. If the ball is in impact with the player, reverse speedY of the ball. Else if the ball is in impact with the wall, which is the bricks, minus the number of bricks by 1 if the brick is broken. Else if the ball is in impact with the border, reverse speedX of the ball. Else if the ball is in impact with the upper border of the frame, reverse speedY of the ball. Else if the ball drops below the frame, minus ballCount by 1 and set ballLost to true;

    • impactWall

      private boolean impactWall()
      Check if there is impact by the ball for every brick. Check the direction of the impact. If the impact is from the up and down direction, reverse the speedY of the ball. If the impact is from the left and right direction, reverse the speedX of the ball. If there is no impact between the ball and the brick, then return false.
      Returns:
      A boolean value whether the brick is broken.

    • impactBorder

      private boolean impactBorder()
      Check if the ball is in impact with the border.
      Returns:
      A boolean value whether the ball is in impact with the border.

    • setBallLost

      Parameters:
      ballLost - A boolean value containing the value for ballLost.

    • ballReset

      public void ballReset()
      Move the player to the start position. Move the ball to the start position. Randomly assign integer between -2 and 3 to speedX and randomly assign integer between 0 to -3 to speedY of the ball. Set the speed of the ball. Set ballLost to false.

    • wallReset

      public void wallReset()
      Reset all the bricks to their original state. Set the brickCount to the length of the brick array.

    • ballEnd

      public boolean ballEnd()
      Check if the there is no more ball. If ballCount equals to 0, then return true. Else, return false.
      Returns:
      A boolean value whether the ballCount equals to 0.

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      Check if the level is done by the user. Check if all the bricks are destroyed by the user. If brickCount equals to 0, then return true. Else, return false.
      Returns:
      A boolean value whether the brickCount equals to 0.

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      Go to the next level. Set the brickCount to the length of the brick array.

    • hasLevel

      public boolean hasLevel()
      Check if there is any level left. If level is less than the length of the levels array, then return true. Else, return false.
      Returns:
      A boolean value whether there is any levels left.

    • setBallXSpeed

      Parameters:

    • setBallYSpeed

      public void setBallYSpeed(int s)
      Set the value of speedY of the ball.
      Parameters:
      s - An int value containing the value for speedY of the ball.

    • resetBallCount

      public void resetBallCount()
      Reset the number of balls, ballCount. Set the ballCount to 3.
